item.title: The UTM grid and the MGRS grid: not quite the same
item.description: Summary Grids are widely used in biodiversity monitoring to define the basic spatial units for data collection, data processing or mapping. In this post I explain differences between the UTM and MGRS grids, provide references to their full definition and refer to some software implementations for MGRS. Main points: The UTM grid and the MGRS grid outside the polar regions are both derived from the UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) map projection system.
